result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Troy T Gill

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Troy T Gill in court.  Attorney Dennis P Coffey in court for Troy T Gill.  Attorney Patrick Franken appeared on behalf of Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Defense counsel requests an adjournment, due to reasons put forth on the record. No objections from the State. Court grants request and orders case adjourned for a prompt plea hearing date before Judge Dee, Br 37.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Troy T Gill appeared by video.  Attorney Dennis P Coffey appeared by video for Troy T Gill.  Attorney Amy Spanczak for Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a projected guilty plea date. Case adjourned, Branch 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Troy T Gill appeared by video.  Attorney Dennis P Coffey appeared by video for Troy T Gill.  Attorney Annie Louk in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense to file motion to suppress and requested extension to file.  Court granted defense request.  Defense to file motion by September 1, 2022.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 16; VIA ZOOM.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Troy T Gill in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Troy T Gill appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense has discovery and an offer. Requesting additional time to review both with defendant. Court sets 08/23/22 as the deadline to file motions. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Troy T Gill in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 16, Judge Grayson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Troy T Gill in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
